oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Townes Van Zandt - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Townes Van Zandt (musician). The episode was set to air on an unidentified date. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Townes Van Zandt
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Townes Van Zandt Pulsebeat show -- (00:41) At My Window (Townes Van Zandt) -- (04:34) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (04:39) Dial 901 [unconfirmed] ([Unidentified]) -- (05:46) Spangler reveals Van Zandt's unique styling; additionally, Van Zandt reflects on why he believes so much music came out of Texas -- (06:56) Spangler reflects on Van Zandt's low-profile nature, and Van Zandt reveals why he had decided to record again -- (07:59) Spangler and Van Zandt reflect on what was happening in Van Zandt's life when he wrote ""Pancho and Lefty"" -- (08:58) Pancho and Lefty (Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard) -- (12:30) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (12:44) Spangler introduces Van Zandt to reflect on what he believes life is about -- (14:05) The Rake (Townes Van Zandt) -- (17:25) Spangler and Van Zandt discuss the difficulties his mother received from 'The Late, Great Townes Van Zandt' -- (18:29) If You Needed Me (Townes Van Zandt) -- (21:23) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (21:40) Spangler asks Van Zandt what song he wished to hear -- (21:88) White Freightliner (Jimmie Dale Gilmore) -- (25:11) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Van Zandt, Townes;
